virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::current_joint_value_changed ( bool &  b,
sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
int  n,
part_class *const *  parts,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when current joint values are changed. (Ref: Memory-Resident Plugins).

current_joint_value_changing() is called during joint slider or IK drag operations.

Parameters:
b Not currently used.
scene the scene with the joint object
n the number of objects with modifed joint values
parts The array of objects with modified joint values. When multiple joints are moved simultaneously by IK operations, the child joint is arrayed first.
virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::current_joint_value_changing ( bool &  b,
sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
int  n,
part_class *const *  parts,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when the current joint values are being changed.

Called during a joint slider or IK drag operation.

Because it cannot be called when a joint value is inserted numerically, use current_joint_value_changed() to get the joint value change.

Parameters:
b Not currently used.
scene the scene with the joint
n the number of changing joints
parts The array of joint parts that changed. If multiple joints were moved by an IK operation, the array is numbered from the child part.
virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::delete_self ( void *  aux = 0  )  [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Explicitly deleted the interface.

Deletes the interface using the derived override function. Used to delete window interface controls.

Reimplemented in sxsdk::window_interface::control_base_class, and sxsdk::window_interface.

virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::idle_task ( bool &  b,
sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called periodically.

Because this function is called constantly when Shade starts, the process here affects the overall performance. If used, heavy processes must be avoided.

Parameters:
b Not currently used.
scene the currently active scene
virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::initialize_dialog ( sxsdk::dialog_interface &  dialog,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called before the dialog box is displayed.

This function is called when saved as a responder with dialog_interface::set_responder().

Called before the dialog item is generated, before calling dialog_interface::ask().

Parameters:
dialog the displayed dialog box
virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::joint_matrix ( bool &  b,
part_class &  part,
float  weight,
sxsdk::mat4 &  t,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when the matrix value for the joint is needed. Overridden joint_matrix() can modify the matrix value t.

The joint can replace the matrix transformation given to the object.

Since it is called for all the joints every time the Figure window redraws, the processes here affect the overall performance. If used, avoid heavy processes.

This function only replaces the argument t. Processes that change the scene are not guaranteed.

Parameters:
b Not currently used.
part the joint object
weight The joint weight. The weight of the binding from 0.0 to 1.0 is passed when the bound vertex is processed by the skin.
t The transformation matrix. Overwrite to replace the matrix transformation given to the object.
virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::load_dialog_data ( sxsdk::dialog_interface &  dialog,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when the values of dialog items must be updated from the internal data.

This function is called by saving as a responder with dialog_interface::set_responder().

Parameters:
dialog the target dialog box

virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::make_wireframe ( sxsdk::shape_class &  shape,
const sxsdk::mat4 &  mat,
int  view,
int  flags,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Virtual function. Used in attribute_interface, creator_interface, modifier_interface derived functions.

make_wireframe() works in the Attribute plugin, Creator plugin, and Modifier plugin.

If doing custom wireframe drawings, see also attribute_interface::make_wireframe(), creator_interface::make_wireframe(), and modifier_interface::make_wireframe().

Reimplemented in sxsdk::creator_interface, and sxsdk::modifier_interface.

const sxsdk::shape_class &  shape,
const sxsdk::joint_value_class &  value,
float  weight,
sxsdk::mat4 &  t,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]
Parameters:
shape the joint object
weight The joint weight. The weight of the binding from 0.0 to 1.0 is passed when the bound vertex is processed by the skin.
t The transformation matrix. Overwrite to replace the matrix transformation given to the object.

virtual bool sxsdk::plugin_interface::respond ( sxsdk::dialog_interface &  dialog,
dialog_item_class &  item,
int  action,
void *  aux 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when the user operates on the dialog item.

In addition to buttons that add an item, also called for the OK, Cancel, Reset, and Default buttons.

This function is called by saving as a responder with dialog_interface::set_responder().

Parameters:
dialog the target dialog box
item the target dialog item
action The type of action. (enums::dialog_item_action_enum)
aux When the dialog item is a list box and the checkbox is clicked, this is the pointer (int *) to the index of that list box item. Otherwise, 0.
virtual void sxsdk::plugin_interface::save_dialog_data ( sxsdk::dialog_interface &  dialog,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when the internal data must be updated from the values of dialog items.

This function is called by saving as a responder with dialog_interface::set_responder().

Parameters:
dialog the target dialog box

virtual int sxsdk::plugin_interface::terminate ( sxsdk::dialog_interface &  dialog,
int  result,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when the dialog box is being dismissed.

This function is called by saving as a responder with dialog_interface::set_responder().

Called after a dialog item objects is corrupted. Use save_dialog_data() to get the dialog item value.

Parameters:
dialog the target dialog box
result The button clicked when closing the dialog box. 1: OK 2: Cancel
